2.translation-en: Look out, the snake may bite you.

3.translation-en: Your dog did not bite me.

4.full_text: murra walgaani buka yanhthabarra gigaanha manhdharra
4.translation-en: Now all of you women go out to fetch bullrushes.

6.translation-en: I give back your meat to you.

7.full_text: ngutyalha ngathu inha bakarranyi/ yundru nganha ngutyadhikarri nguthi
7.translation-en: When/if I give back the boomerang, you will give me back the meat.

notes: bare verb = IMP; dhika = some kind of directional meaning 'back/away' used with imperatives?

10.translation-en: This dog is sick (and) it will die, I think.

13.translation-en: This dog will die, I think.

notes: noise or ear? deaf often =earless in Ab'l lanugages
'deaf' words are often 'ear-priv' in the languages of the region. ngara is also recorded as "hear".
note that adj has NOM case and occurs before the noun this time (contrast with other sentences--'My dog is good/bad')

21.translation-en: The mob of men (together) are strong.

25.translation-en: The two of you eat this food.

26.translation-en: The water is to the left, you will go. (To the water left, you will go.)

27.translation-en: The water is to the right, you will go. (To the water right, you will go.)

30.translation-en: Wait, I will tell you straight.
notes: Not sure if this also has the -wari 'vertical' suffix on it, and dhuna is not correctly glossed.
Note another adverb going directly after the vern.

36.translation-en: He didn't eat any food today.

38.translation-en: This man is angry with me.

39.translation-en: Why is that man angry with me?

41.translation-en: That's why he is angry with you.

42.full_text: murrawali nganyi wagarra/ galgurigala nganyi mugaanga
42.translation-en: All right, I will lie down, I am tired [for sleep].

45.translation-en: Two big men are coming this way [returning?].

46.translation-en: Two small men are coming this way.

notes: tense - should this be 'I will stand up' since -ra marks future?

49.translation-en: The two of you stand up.

notes: Note verb with tense marking comes first ("speak-pres you Galali")
example - response to basic introduction question (Do you speak Galali?)
example - response to basic introduction question (Do you speak Galali?)

54.translation-en: Yes well, completely I understand them. [OK, I understand them.]

57.translation-en: Speak to the two of us.

58.translation-en: Good, I will speak to you.

59.translation-en: OK, the two of us will speak to you.

60.translation-en: Good, we will all speak to you.

61.translation-en: Come on, we will talk to that one over there.
